Posted: September 2
It's cute and it's calming so long as you weren't expecting too much in the way of making original pieces. It's mostly clip art.

As someone who creates art often, I found this game to be quaint & relaxing at first. Though as I tried to play through the sticker creation process I found myself having trouble. I kept feeling completely stone-walled when trying to create new ideas. Some things I would recommend in an update for the developer. And if these thing are already incorporated make them potentially easier to find or give more hope that they will be coming or available as you progress through the game. Either through xp gain or purchasing in the shop.

- Have individual sticker components have their own sticker boarder sliders to control the their width
- Have the ability to change the colors on simple pre-made stickers (like the plants) People are intuitive, they can make anything given the right silhouette of a shape.
- Have a pen to draw fine lines with. What really drew me to this game was the rocket in that gradient night sky. I was so disappointed when I found out I couldn't make my own gradient. Let alone tweak the one provided to be a different color.
- Have sticker components scale disproportionately. I would have loved to make a lot of things, had I not found that the objects I was working with only grew and shrank keeping their aspect ratio. I would have loved to have a really long arrow. Or perhaps an oval instead of a circle. I found I couldn't make shapes or patterns that I wanted because I couldn't edit the size of some objects to my liking.

I can get behind buying new colors, shapes & pre-made stickers in the base shop. It gives you something to work towards. But as an artist I feel like every trick I tried to incorporate to make this the best experience possible got stone-walled. These things were missing, or the settings that were already in place were lacking. I felt as though all that was left to do was put the pre-made pixel art together. Like forcing a square peg into a round hole.

Posted: October 16, 2022
Quack. 🦆

This is less a game and more of an experience. No, you cannot control the ducks. But you CAN watch them. And by watching them, you can witness SO MUCH.

One of my ducks had babies which it promptly abandoned. Another duck stabbed a Flamingo pool floaty and it deflated. Another duck went around the pond so fast that it JETTISONED ITSELF INTO THE OCEAN and disappeared over the horizon, forever. I cried.

It's like a soap opera. With rubber ducks. You never know what's going to happen next.

I streamed this game and narrated the events for five hours. Every time the duck bar began to fill toward a new duck, chat would chant, "DUCK IMMINENT". When I was done I immediately bought the DLC. A bunch of my friends bought the game and began gifting it to friends. I already can't wait to play again and check out the new ducks in the DLC.

I hope that the creators continue to create new ducks and features, because they're onto a real ducking winner of a game here.

Posted: February 26
Two ducks arrived at my pool, one of wood and one of cloth. They began as strangers, but at time went by and the breeze in the summer sky changed, so did their circumstances; they were blown towards each other and it was love at first sight. They floated together for ages, rarely straying from one another. Even when they were apart, they always ended up reuniting with one another in a beautiful display of petroleum passion; things were perfect.

But then came another, one with a burning hatred for the life of lonliness he led. For though the pool was a world of joy and love, he felt none. Enraged, he began pursuing the two lovers, determined to make them feel the same pain that he had known for his isolated existance.

He set the wooden duck ablaze, the fire burning with the intensity of the jealousy of the relationship he yearned for, but could never have. It took only moments for the cloth duck to notice that their partner NAY, their very purpose of creation burning in agony and crying out to them. The cloth duck rushed to help, only to be ignited by the same destructive flames that now consumed the wooden one.

But neither would dare leave each other. for without one, the other could never be whole. So instead, they endured the pain, gazing into each other's eyes. Through the pain they felt as their plastic flesh became scorched, they endured. For the pain of living apart would be far worse than that of the flames.

They still float together, their dedication to each other brighter than even the most intense pool light, never to be snuffed out.

tl;dr 2 highly flammable ducks are inseparable for some reason and the lava duck hates them for it


and that was my first experience with these ducks. God I love them so much! 10/10 would recommend

Edit: apparently the firefighter duck hates them too; it has been staring at them burning and seems to actively avoid extinguishing them

Posted: December 17, 2022
No words can even begin to express the beauty and complexion of this game. No, this is no game, this is a masterpiece. My review could never dream to do any justice for this simple masterpiece, but I shall continue forward in my writing. Not a second goes by where I am not running this game, time is simply too finite, too short, to achieve this games fullest potential. "What if no one else stays by this game eternally?!" "What if no one reaches the maximum amount of ducks on the map at one?!" These are questions I have asked myself, these are the questions that have driven me to push forward on my mission. When my computer is open, I must have Placid Plastic Duck Simulator open, even if my computer grows to a heat close to that of the sun when I have 5 other games open, I must continue to run Placid Plastic Duck Simulator, for who else will. It is not only for the fact that no one else may run this game for eternity, but also for the mysteries, that I run this game. What is the meaning of the door, is it related to the chalkboard duck from the More Ducks DLC in any way? If the Ski Duck from Quacking on the Ice (DLC) can be unthawed when the campfire is lit, can the ice of the hockey rink be thawed as well to release the yeti duck. Despite both of these ideas being very unlikely, they still both drive me to let the game run, as letting the game run is the only way to experience any special event. I still can't believe how unknown a game so paradoxically colossal yet simple as this is. It is the best game ever known to man, and consequentially the most underrated as well.

Posted: July 19
Chilli con carne recipe

if you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding Chilli con carne recipe you've come to the right place,

Ingredients

1 large onion
1 red pepper
2 garlic cloves
1 tbsp oil
1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder (or 1 level tbsp if you only have mild)

1 tsp paprika
1 tsp ground cumin
500g lean minced beef
1 beef stock cube
400g can chopped tomatoes
½ tsp dried marjoram
1 tsp sugar (or add a thumbnail-sized piece of dark chocolate along with the beans instead, see tip)

2 tbsp tomato purée
410g can red kidney beans
plain boiled long grain rice, to serve
soured cream, to serve

Directions

STEP 1
Prepare your vegetables. Chop 1 large onion into small dice, about 5mm square. The easiest way to do this is to cut the onion in half from root to tip, peel it and slice each half into thick matchsticks lengthways, not quite cutting all the way to the root end so they are still held together. Slice across the matchsticks into neat dice.

STEP 2
Cut 1 red pepper in half lengthways, remove stalk and wash the seeds away, then chop. Peel and finely chop 2 garlic cloves.

STEP 3
Start cooking. Put your pan on the hob over a medium heat. Add 1 tbsp oil and leave it for 1-2 minutes until hot (a little longer for an electric hob).

STEP 4
Add the onion and cook, stirring fairly frequently, for about 5 minutes, or until the onion is soft, squidgy and slightly translucent.

STEP 5
Tip in the garlic, red pepper, 1 heaped tsp hot chilli powder or 1 level tbsp mild chilli powder, 1 tsp paprika and 1 tsp ground cumin.

STEP 6
Give it a good stir, then leave it to cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

STEP 7
Brown 500g lean minced beef. Turn the heat up a bit, add the meat to the pan and break it up with your spoon or spatula. The mix should sizzle a bit when you add the mince.

STEP 8
Keep stirring and prodding for at least 5 minutes, until all the mince is in uniform, mince-sized lumps and there are no more pink bits. Make sure you keep the heat hot enough for the meat to fry and become brown, rather than just stew.

STEP 9
Make the sauce. Crumble 1 beef stock cube into 300ml hot water. Pour this into the pan with the mince mixture.


info.
This great chilli recipe has to be one of the best dishes to serve to friends for a casual get-together. An easy sharing favourite that uses up storecupboard ingredients.
it's also freezable

Posted: June 19
It’s cold. It should be cold, but I can’t feel anything. A flurry of snow rains down around me as I slide across a frozen pool.

A Zamboni without a driver pushes past me, moving the others to the gondola lift. I do not know if it chose to ignore me or if it just missed. I don’t think I’ll ever know.

There’s a lot of things I’ll never know. Who I am, for example. I know what I am, but I don’t know what I look like. I’m a duck, a rubber duck to be exact. The others are too—they slide past me, sometimes float past me, if we’re in water—and they wear all sorts of colors and designs.

All I know for certain is that I quack sometimes, seemingly at random. I can’t control it; it just happens.

I don’t think the others are aware, like I am. I think I’m the only one who’s really here. In a sense, I’m alone...and yet I’m not.

Someone else is here. It’s not one of the ducks. It’s something else entirely, a different sort of entity. They’ve never done anything to any of us, but I sense their presence. I know they’re here. I can feel them. But all they do is watch.

Am I happy with this life? I can’t say. I can’t remember anything else. As far as I know, I’ve always been a rubber duck.

It could be worse. Some of the others catch fire. Some of them fly off the mountain, never to be seen again. I’ve even seen one explode. Me? I just float endlessly, without a care in the world. Nothing to do. No need for food. For money.

But it could be better. If there was just one other duck here, aware, like I am... Would that be better? Would it be better to have someone like me, even if we couldn’t communicate? I guess I’ll never know.

It’s getting dark. Darker than nighttime, that is. So dark that I can’t see, not even the warm glow of fire that is always burning. But this is normal.

The other presence fades. The ducks remain.

I am alone.

Posted: July 14, 2022

MY RATING: 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 ✘ ✘ ✘ 7 / 10

I was actually going to say that the game is kinda totally useless. But then I can't do that, because somehow I've grown to love the very different rubber duckies and that wouldn't be entirely fair to the rubber duckies either.
So let's just agree on conditionally useful. That sounds a lot nicer too.

Somehow the game is also funny, even if you can't do anything but watch the rubber duckies splashing around and unfortunately also when they burn or melt in the sun.

Yes, you heard that right, no ♥♥♥♥. and I didn't think at first that the game would be too unforgiving to me.


I don't know if a hint from the developer would not have been bad. I mean,

But apart from this shocking experience, the game is also good as a screensaver or as a GPU burn-in test.
Since there are no settings for graphics options / performance, depending on the GPU model, the computer can take off or you have the feeling of sitting next to a jet plane. In this case I can only recommend you to set the FPS to 30 via the graphics card settings. That's enough, protects the GPU as well as your ears and nerves.

If you want to run the game in window mode, you can define your own resolution in the game's start options (Library, right mouse button > Proberties under General).
All you have to do is enter e.g. -screen-width 1200 -screen-height 720, or of course the resolution you want and you're done. After the game starts, just press ALT+Enter and voila, windowed mode.

Apart from the screen saver option, the game offers 15 achievements that all work and unlock themselves and are also counted in the statistics.
So the only thing you have to do is start the game, wait and watch the ducks splash, or not. As you wish. I would like to briefly point out the burning rubber ducky again because, yes, I think you know what I mean...

And what is perhaps still missing for perfect bathing happiness are the trading cards that one or the other would like to have. Time will tell if we can still get them. I hope there won't be a burning rubber ducky on it...

So let's hold on:
If you would like to have a few more achievements and a perfect game, are looking for a new screensaver or maybe want to see the burning rubber ducky, you will certainly not go wrong with the game.
Everyone else can save it.

Have fun 💖






✅ funny to watch

Posted: May 29
Placid Plastic Duck

 It would be greatly appreciated if you would rate this review with a prize, although it is not necessary. If you want to read more reviews like this follow me as a mentor. If you want to discuss the reviews and talk to other people in my Steam group. The links:  My Mentor Page   My Group Page  

This game is a misunderstood gem that currently needs to get the recognition it deserves.

But you may wonder, why is it supposedly so good? Well, then I will answer your question. Placid Plastic Duck is about some ducks in a swimming pool and it's true, this may seem very boring, but that would only be judging a book by its cover.

In the game you start with a duck in the pool, you will not be able to move it, since it moves by itself and you will only be able to see it from outside or get in the first person, after a while every few minutes another duck will arrive and another and another... Until you have more ducks than days in the sun.

In Placid Plastic Duck you can fulfill your fantasy of having a gigantic number of ducks, being able to have them of different rarities, patterns and colors, in addition to the fact that there are some that can interact with each other and this not only happens with the ducks from the base game, but also with those of the dlcs.

As an experienced player with all the achievements I have witnessed many interactions, there is a duck with a candle that can burn an ice cube to unlock an easter duck (sorry for the joke) and yes, you read that right, there are SECRET ducks, there are several ducks that They can be obtained in the normal map and other secrets that are from the other dlc map, like these there are many interactions, such as a ninja duck that you have to find hidden or a duck that has to capture a ghost duck on camera.

Placid Plastic Duck are not just ducks, they are THE ducks you want to have, you have many types and each one can be more or less to your liking, this game accompanied by its own music can help you relax while you study or finish a job, this game , is what YOU NEED.

Have you ever wanted to do nothing? Well now you can! Even better yet, have you wanted to do nothing, but WITH rubber duckies of various suits and unique cosmetics? Well the waits over folks, now you can literally sit there and do nothing but watch little duckies float around in a relaxing environment and quack your little heart out.

Various events can take place depending on what ducks you have on hand. I got an achievement for getting a floaty popped by the pool. Do I know how? Heck no i don't, why? Cuz I was doing NOTHING.
Now even YOU can do nothing by yourself or with friends ONLINE! This game is nuts and I live for it. Its great for making you sleepy, or for those moods that you have no clue what game you wanna play. Just watch DUCKS!!
Even includes some nice background music to enjoy, however it does have some questionable ones, mainly on the first level where the relaxing music turns to either 1 of 2 odd tracks. 1 being just a lotta Spanish outta nowhere. The other being a deep voice also speaking some not-English language.
We always got youtube if the music is less desired.
GO WATCH YOU SOME DUCK!

While there have been a lot of idle games, where the goal is essentially to watch the game play it self for you, Placid Plastic Duck Simulator is somewhat one of a kind.
It quite literally requires no action by the player, just sit there, and watch ducks. Oh hey another duck spawned. Oh this one has a propeller hat, look at him go fly away ducky!
There is nothing to really excuse my hrs on record playing the game, but I would say for the price, fantastic thing to have in the background while you work on other tasks, the chill beats, the ambient sounds, the random quacks as the camera zips from duck to duck, all with unique designs that make them appealing to watch float in your pool.
Oh there he goes down the slide, that is adorable!
Calling this a game is somewhat unfair, as its not trying to be. Almost all the achievements require no action from the player, nor is the player able to do anything other than move from spot to spot. Leave the game on long enough, and your achievement list will be full sooner or later.
The pool areas that are available are very beautiful, with lots of hidden details and random events that occur on both, somewhat guaranteeing you entertainment every time you glance back at the duck pool.
Oh my duck just got abducted by aliens. And they replaced it with an alien duck. Neat.

There is not really a point to anything you do here, and you can get some added dlc that is also very cheap, and has a lovely ammount of ducks, with unique mechanics and attention to detail leaving me satisfied with the pricing. But they do add up eventually in cost.
There is also the issue of lack of settings, the resolution being changed does not really help lower end systems, and having too many ducks can prove for a very lag filled experience, without the ability to lower the settings to compensate.
With the unlocked ability to mess with the radio, I was also hoping for some more music variety, but I was sad to find out not really much else.
Some of the dlc has added some more active achievements, but they do not add up to much more than clicking on stuff. There are also some hidden... lore bits? Alternate reality game hints? That were fun to figure out, and I got a cool new duck for it!

Overall, It is a very fun idle experience to check back on while doing other things, the duck designs are fantastic, the interactions between them and the environment are full of attention to detail, with only a few minor flaws. Wonderful execution of the interactive screen saver concept.

Posted: May 13
Explaining Plastic Duck SIm in one sentence: It's a real-time screensaver.

There's more to it than that, but that is the very basic essence of it. There are mini events that randomly occur; planes fly by, curious little UFOs appear to steal a duck away into the night (this literally happened in the background as I was writing this section, thanks game), inflatable pool decorations get popped or knocked in depending on what your ducks do as they float around.

It is absolutely something you put on in the background/a second monitor, or if you want to have passive entertainment while doing something else. I fell asleep with it running, and as someone who has sleeping problems, it was nice to look over after a routine night of randomly waking up from poor sleep to see the ducks still bein' ducks without a care in the world, drifting around on my monitor.

Also a UFO came back and spat out a completely unrelated duck while I was typing this. Not sure what to make of that.

The music in the game is nice, although there's not a lot of it. You have probably ~20-30 minutes of music from the in-game radio that will loop. It's very good, but there isn't enough of it, even though it absolutely fits that mellow vibe of "yeah, the rest of the world kinda sucks, but we're just ducks enjoying what we got."

If you have an anxiety disorder, I can absolutely see this helping.

Posted: January 16
I dunno, man.
I really, REALLY tried to like this game, gave it plenty of time, tried everything it has to offer. I was so excited when I saw it was being developed!
Sadly, it’s just not a fishing game. More like an exploration game with fishing elements where the fishing feels more like an afterthought than the core.
My experience was as follows:

- I decided to log my 2-hour (120 minute) gaming session according to what activity I was doing within the game. I was completing challenge missions on the mission board. The challenges were fishing challenges, but they all required the player to reach or find a specific location. End result: time I spent walking/driving/finding the right spots on the map: 100 minutes. Time I spend fishing: 20 minutes.

- The maps are very large and you are expected to travel to lookout towers in order to unlock markers for locations on your map, then travel to said markers in order to “discover” the locations. The problem, is, while this works perfectly for theHunter, it’s extremely annoying in the Angler. Why? Because in theHunter, walking is what you’re supposed to do. You walk slowly from location to location and hunt while doing it. It’s exciting and gives the player a logical route to take. But the Angler is a fishing game. So walking and driving only takes away from fishing because it’s not like I’m gonna find some random fish in the middle of the road. Most of the missions in the game are 90% traveling and 10% fishing. A lot of the missions (especially in the Norway map) contain no fishing at all.

- The game lacks purely fishing related missions. I finished them all very quickly and then I was left with nothing to do except many tedious flower collecting missions etc...

- The traveling itself is very slow and frustrating. The cars are buggy and you can’t reach many map locations with a car to begin with. Walking is slow, extremely time-consuming and boring.

- It takes a long time to unlock locations on the map, but not all unlocked locations give you a fast travel point. I can’t understand why this is. Every single waterbody etc. should be a fast travel point as the player gains nothing from making multiple walking trips to the same location.

- The game runs pretty bad. I can run TheHunter 70+ fps on ultra graphics, this runs barely 25-30 fps on medium-low. My rig is well above the recommended specs.

- The game crashes a lot. About once every 30 minutes or so.

- The credit/xp system is needlessly complicated. There are literal conspiracy theories on how it actually works because no-one seems to know for sure. What’s wrong with getting a bit of credits/xp for each fish? Just adjust fish worth according to size/rarity etc. The current system is just weird makes fishing feel less rewarding.

- It makes no sense to have a level/xp system in the game if there are no skills to unlock or level requirements for gear. What’s the point?

- The gear is needlessly complicated also. There should be some sort of assistance in pairing rods/reels/lines as the current system leads to people wasting credits on parts that should fit the rest of the gear but just...won’t. The leveling of gear is also a mess similar to the main xp/credit system.

- Tedious inventory restrictions. The player can carry 5 rods and 5 reels with himself at all times but there’s no space for bread crumbs in his pocket if he also carries a selection of different hooks. Have the devs ever heard of a tackle box? (And yes, they come in bigger sizes.) This doubles down on the missing fast travel spots in it’s tiresomeness. Let’s say your mission is to go to a specific spot. Only after you reach said spot will you be told what kind of fish you need to catch. Not carrying the exact tackle you need? You have to fast travel back to the shop to access your storage, and then walk all the way back to the mission spot because there’s no fast travel location anywhere near. Just… why? I really really hope tackle boxes and storage boxes aren’t a problem the devs invented on purpose just to offer paid DLC as a solution later.

- The achievements in the game downright discourage fishing. Most of the achievements revolve around exploration, points of interest, collectibles, you name it. The actual fishing related ones are easy and fast to get. It would have been nice to get some long-term fishing achievements to work towards.

- The fishing itself is not very intuitive. I get that the developers were trying to achieve “realism”, but it’s important to remember that this is a game and games are supposed to be fun. The game won’t allow you to just pick a random spot and throw your bobble into the water because the fish spawn at very specific locations. This means that a lot of the water area doesn’t have fish spawns at all, thus you can’t pick a spot at random and catch a fish. You have to go around looking at the water and physically see the fish you want to catch before commencing the actual fishing. I don’t know about the devs but I’ve been fishing at a freshwater lake for almost 30 years and as long as you sit down, have a bait of some sort and just wait, you’ll always catch something sooner or later. And no, I don’t need to circle the lake for hours trying to make eye-contact with the fish before choosing a spot. I can see that many others had this same complaint of not catching any fish if they just wanted to fish intuitively.

- The missions at the Norway map disappointed me deeply and they are the reason why I’m writing this review. The developers got A LOT of backlash for focusing on exploration over fishing. I was expecting them to listen to their customers when making the Norway reserve. But to my astonishment, they doubled down on the exploration! The new map has missions that forego fishing completely and just send you running around, looking for “clues” and “caches”. The hints given are pretty bad and I just can’t imagine who thought this would be a good idea / fun for anyone. The results speak for themselves, no-one even cares enough to make guide on how to finish these missions.

All and all this is one of those “I wonder if they actually played their own game before releasing it”- products. It’s more exploration than fishing. And, sadly, it’s more tedious than fun.
I wouldn't be this harsh if the game was in early access and by all accounts, it should be in early access. But it's not so I waited a few months and then took it at face value.

Posted: August 31, 2022
Don't expect a finished polished product. Despite calling this a full release this is very much an early access project that needs a lot of work. There are many good features and visuals and many bad or outright missing features and visuals.

The world itself looks incredible but the Water, the most important aspect in a fishing game, looks awful and blurry and your bobbers are all but invisible on the surface unless very close to you. actually fighting the fish is good but then there is an awful immersion breaking black screen cut to you suddenly holding the fish when you catch it, no pulling the fish out of the water or netting it.

character customization is nice but the "type 1" (male) character model is derpy looking and has a bad case of man-boobs.

Fishing lures are extremely generic and simple, and many do not work as they are supposed to. baits for float fishing are ok but the selection of hard plastic lures is awful, and the soft plastics are incredibly bad, there aren't even different color options just different sizes for the same color of grub, shad, etc. Fishing lures in the real world are designed to catch the fisherman as much as the fish, with tens of thousands of designs, colors, and techniques to choose from, so for a real world Angler to come to this game and find a single design of crankbait, swimbait, frog, jerkbait, and spinnerbait, with only a single color option for each size of lure, is awfully disappointing. color choice of a lure is incredibly important when fishing, weather, water clarity, local baitfish, etc. all play a part and while i don't expect such things to be implemented in a game like this having the option to at least pretend the color choice matters would be nice for immersion.

The ability to toggle between retrieval types when reeling is good and something I wish more fishing games had. Casting is atrocious, both in the button mechanics and animations, there is nothing remotely approaching realistic casting physics, and no one has ever cast a lure like they do in this game in the history of mankind, at least not without throwing the lure straight into the ground and backlashing. Please let us walk while the line is cast and/or fish is on the hook.

All in all the game is a very frustrating mix of great and terrible mechanics and great and terrible visuals. it feels like the developers have definitely put some effort into the game but also like they have never played any of the decent fishing games on the market before, let alone gone fishing in real life beyond a guided trip or two where someone else did the hard work for them. Fishing planet, Ultimate fishing simulator, and fishing sim world all have lessons that could have been learned to use to improve this game. this game has the potential to outshine any of those in the future, but is not there yet.

I have wanted EW to make a fishing game since long before this was ever announced and I hate to be giving a negative review to a game I have been anticipating for so long but there is hope for the future. TheHunter COTW and classic are both miles better games now than they were when they released and this dev has a history of sticking with their games in the long term with consistent updates of both free and paid content. I pray that they continue to listen to their community and improve this game, and hope to be able to change this review relatively soon.

ETA: I want to be clear that there is still some fun to be had in this game, and i intend to play it for a while, and i believe it will eventually be a great game if the developers stick with it and do not abandon it. I just want people to be aware of what they are getting into at this early point in the game. Also my game has now crashed twice, both after or while interacting with the shop.

Norway Reserve Update: coming back to the game a bit with the addition of the new reserve, glad to see it being given for free. The game is definitely moving in the right direction, and the map design and landscape visuals continue to shine in the new reserve, though water still has issues particularly with odd shadows that traverse the water from the sides and vertically as you move your head, at least on Norway. I think this was a good choice of location for the new reserve and the higher level gear is appropriately more expensive to grind for, giving some more purpose to actually grinding money which is good. fish movement and behavior when fighting has definitely improved and feels more on par with other fishing games now, particularly with the harder fighting fish like the new salmon. fishing with lures/jigs still feels inconsistent to me compared to the float fishing which seems to have a much higher success rate in quickly getting a bite, i could just need to do more research into whether a specific retrieve is needed and proper hook size etc. though i am making sure to use baits listed as preferred by the fish im targeting. Limiting to 30 inventory slots still feels way too restrictive for no real reason imo and just means you practically have to go back to a store every time you want to target a different species.

The game still has a ways to go and many of my other complaints and positives from initial review remain true as well, but it is definitely headed in the right direction and I still believe it can be a great game if they continue to stick with it. my review would be in more of a grey area now but I still say buy it if you aren't too picky about your fishing games and just want something to chill with, and/or you are willing to wait for it to live up to it's potential.

Okay, I hate to waste time leaving reviews in general let alone negative ones but i feel compelled to do so here.

I wanted to like this game and I gave it a fair shot at over 30 hours played.. and...eh..

The visuals are fine, i see complaints about the water. It didn't bother me and thought it worked/looked fine. The species of fish were fine to me and amount. I liked the rods and reels..I enjoyed the cosmetics, etc.. all of what I like is aesthetic though, it finally hit me.

The game just doesn't know what it wants to be.

I DO NOT understand why we cannot keep our fish as trophies. This instantly turned a friend of mine off of the game. They literally asked ('but we can put our big catches in the lodge right'??). NOPE. sorry. you must release all fish and you cannot keep any as actual trophies. I mean we have lodges in hunter. just link the lodge through apex connect and let us keep fish trophies. sorry no. just toss it back and move on. PETA wouldn't approve.?

I DO NOT understand why we cannot simply invite a friend to play with us like their other hunting game. Oh no. here we MUST create an account and login, then join some server and join with a bunch of randos. Like this is some MMO type of game or something. this is horrible. All I wanted to do was jump into some fishing with a friend of mine. just us, very simple. but no. you need an account, you have to login, you have to join some rando server etc.. i mean why? why is this so convoluted when their other game is not.. no ty.

I DO NOT understand why we need to run around and collect sticks, bugs, bark and other stuff in this park.. I want to fish. period. nothing else. This isn't a hunting game where you are already in the woods roaming around and naturally come upon a point of interest. In this game you want to be on or next to the water fishing. NOT roaming the shire looking for random stuff Bilbo has laying around or diseased trees with full fishing gear on. This is ridiculous. This all needs to be removed. A simple solution? Just make some quests where we can get plastic out of the lakes, or maybe fish up old line and hooks, etc. you know stuff that you may do while actually fishing and not something that has you running around mines and mountains like you are in Moiria headed to Mordor..

I DO NOT understand why the handbook is so limited and lacking. Sorry I cant remember 70 dang types of lures and hook sizes and baits and what sizes exactly go with what etc.. The hand book gives you some basic idea of the fish and what they like. but it is severely lacking hook sizes. At least the handbook should add things to the fish 'description' when you try it and it works.. so ..you know, you can go back and look. because that's great if you are a pro fisher, I'm not and there is no way i'm going to remember all the baits and hook sizes that go with every type of fish and then add the 'ranks' on top of that. its just not happening. The book should add things or info as we go along or unlock new 'finds' so we can simply find that info later on. because I am def not remembering all this and I'm not making spreadsheets for this GAME.

Speaking of the hooks and whatnot. They make no sense to me. I've been fishing a bit, no where near a pro lol, but I'm not completely ignorant. I'm sorry this game needs some serious leeway.. You need to be exact literally exact to catch fish in my 30+ hour experience I've found. You need (just an example I'm making up) a size #4 hook to catch LM Bass. okay. If you use a #3. NOPE. sorry. bass don't even think its there. This is so game breaking and nauseating to have to be THAT exact with fishing. I've been fishing I have caught some bluegill with very large hooks, almost comical but they got hooked somehow, and the exact opposite has happened too with a larger fish swallowing a small hook or getting it stuck in gills. This game. you need to be 100% using the literal exact # hook size or the fish ignore the bait. At least make it so the fish attempt the 'bite'.. the game could adjust and give the fish a % chance to throw the hook or become free if it goes for a #3 over the 'needed' #4 for bass. its just off-putting how this is done and feels in game, having to be literally so exact on-the-nose.

The issue above also makes the game.. boring after my 30+ hours. I know if i cast this exact bait with this hook # then I am getting a gold like every time with a silver tossed in here and there. This just needs to be way more random, which goes along with what i stated above. Its just to literal and on-the-nose.

Can we get 3rd person boats and 'jeeps'?

Can we make 'jeeps' not feel like they are on ice.?

Can we please be allowed to change the time of day? I would like to be able to fish at night time with out having to wait an entire day cycle to do so and then feel rushed.. Makes it not-so-fun to find those catfish spots.

Can we fish bobber-less please, just drop bait down into the lake. like Cheese, weight, drop over board for those bottom feeders?

Can we fish up random stuff? like.. Line, Hooks, garbage maybe, the odd turtle here or there, etc. Also tie the quests to this type of stuff, not the shire/bilbo item collecting crap.

I could go on but I am going to stop here at this point.

This game IMO should of been made into the next map of Hunter CoTW along with the hunting. A full 'outdoor' experience. As a stand alone game this game is just kind of a mess and goes in different directions and tries things that just do not work out at all, and leaves some things out completely that we are use to from the hunting game..

As is stands now I am sorry but I did give this game a fair shot and i did want to like and really enjoy it. But i just cannot and do not recommend this game to others as it stands now. There are just to many 'issues' once the 'pretty back round' phase has passed.

sorry this is a no-buy IMO..

Posted: September 2, 2022
Welp... this is quite embarrassingly poor and disappointing. As someone who has checked fishing every year on both editions of theHunter's yearly surveys, this just hurts. I've sunk some time into it, and the best way that I can describe it is that they played the telephone game with experienced anglers trying to communicate fishing to game designers, then to a bunch of programmers whose outside experience was limited to hiking to the bus stop, then actually made by interns on a serious crunch.

For the uninitiated, the game is a dual fishing/exploration experience, which is a fantastic concept, and that has absolutely massive potential, with exploration being rewarding too. It is made in one of the most beautiful open world engines out there, after all.

Here are my biggest gripes about the core of the game:
- Buggy. Very, very buggy. Feels like a late alpha build.
- Graphics. Performance for me is good on Ultra, but I have a beefy computer that can handle it. The details are what makes this a problem. Aggressive distance object culling results in eye-sore landscapes, as anything beyond a certain point is barren except from a few 2D bushes and trees. Top that off with FXAA or no AA making those 2D objects really pixelly and unbearable to look at, so TAA is you're only option. Also, V-Sync causes horrible stuttering (almost like an fps drop), and is particularly bad in cutscenes, where it appears like 13 fps while the camera is flying around. Kinda makes you sick.
- The water primarily is the issue here, and is kind of a massive portion of the game. Clearly Apex wasn't designed to handle dynamic water, and I'm guessing making it was taking up too much of EW's time, so a functioning prototype was just put in. There are no waves, just simple movement in some wind direction, or a flowing texture in rivers, without any actual flow. On top of it all, it's surface is just weird, it's like it got blurred out of existence. Bobbers/floats are extraordinarily tiny, and are nearly invisible due to that blurring effect. It's probably worst on Lake Delirium, near the hot springs, where it's basically blue pool water, and it looks like someone spilled blue void paint and fish are swimming in air sometimes.
- Steering for both boat and vehicle M&K is progressive (haven't tried on controller yet), which results in excessive swerving, since a tap is too little, and a short press is too much. It's a much bigger problem on vehicles, though. Something a little more definite would be nice.
- Dialogue can be quite cringy and annoying. Particularly Sophia being a jabber-jack. Having a reduced dialogue option would be nice, since simply turning it off ruins portions of the world.
- Lighting could use some work, particularly around dawn/dusk. As someone who lives in the mountains, it's not quite like someone just turned the lights off when the sun goes behind the mountains.
- Having the ability to change time of day would also be nice. Want to target species that prefer nighttime? Well, pull up your favorite meme page and wait.
- Are you American and don't want to use the Metric system? Well too bad! Even though you've changed your preference to Imperial, most of the measurements are still in Metric, and what is in Imperial has the wrong units. Nobody measures their fish in yards, rarely feet, and almost always in inches. In fact, I'm pretty sure most Metric anglers don't use meters to measure their fish. Units could use to be revised.
- Character customization is awfully lackluster and uncreative. Makes buying apparel pretty much non-existent.
- Missions are often cryptic and sometimes they seem like they just forgot to add in the important stuff. How to Catch a Whitefish - Step 1, get the recommended gear. Okay, what is the recommended gear? It doesn't tell you anywhere, and doesn't allow you to accept anything else until you've completed that.

Exploration:
It's not bad, surprisingly. The only aspect of the game that isn't entirely broken.

Now the fishing aspect of the game... oh boy.
- You have some Ultra-Polarized X-Ray Vision Sunglasses equipped, and you can magically see any and all fish in the water. Makes the fishing dumb and predictable. Oh, there's a fish, I'll just cast to it, and clearly it's working, and I can just watch it take my bait. There is sight fishing in real life, but it's usually in really shallow and/or clear water - the trick is that they can see you too, which these fish don't seem to care too much about.
- Casting is awful. No matter what, you will always cast the same distance, or 2/3 of that with the short cast. No rod, reel, or line combo is going to change that. You shouldn't be able to jig when you cast your line like you do. There's also not an option to let line out, either, so you can jig if you wanted to.
- Once you catch a fish, physics leaves the chat. Reeling in a tired fish bends your rod nearly in half, and puts your line tension up excessively high, meanwhile a fish pulling drag only puts the force meter to your drag setting, and your rod barely reflects that that fish is pulling. The whole point of a drag system is to limit the maximum force exerted on the line, yet simply pumping the rod will nearly max out the tension, entirely bypassing the drag system.
- Speaking of tired fish, well, they don't sometimes. I've seen and caught numerous fish landed with drastically underpowered equipment. I've landed a pissed off 15lbs carp that I foul-hooked in the dorsal on an ultralight rod with 6lb-test line that I was using to catch stocked trout, simply because I managed tension and eventually tired the fish out. In game, I fought with a fish for over 7 minutes, and it just refused to get tired, and you end up in a stalemate with the fish, and you've got to break or cut the line.
- The game description says it realistically places fish based on time, habitat, and temperature, yet you find fish in the most questionable locations. For instance, largemouth bass near the surface in the middle of a lake at 30 meters depth at midday with no cover at 50°F... yeah, that doesn't happen. I can say that with certainty and experience, as I grew up in Wyoming (where Golden Peaks Reserve is supposed to be located) fishing for these exact fish species.
- Some lures attract fish they shouldn't, and some don't attract any. Soft plastics are a joke, and I haven't been able to catch a single fish with any soft-plastics. Trout rarely go after top-water hardbaits like poppers and frogs, but they do in game, sometimes absolutely nothing will be attracted to a spinner (even though that's a universal lure, really). Then baits are sometimes really weird. Nothing wants to bite on a worm? Really? Everything will eat a worm, especially panfish like bluegill, and I'm surprised that they just don't have any effectiveness. Also the preferred baits listed in the handbook often times have absolutely no effect on the intended species.
- Fish are slow and dumb. Since you can see all the fish, you can tell when they're interested in your lure - but they just can't catch up to it, but aren't attracted to a slower retrieve that they can catch up with. Really frustrating sometimes.
- The UI is weird an unintuitive. When bobber fishing, the UI in the corner barely reflects the state of the bobber, and you can usually just look at memes and wait for the audio cue, rather than actually watch your bobber (if you could) or the UI. When spin fishing, you've got a random powering up bar that looks like it belongs on some random piece of tech in a random 80's sci-fi film that really has no effect on gameplay other than being annoying. Also, you've got two more numbers that at least on indicated depth of the lure, and the other, no idea - I presume it tells you in the spin fishing tutorial, but it's bugged.

There's still more, but my fingers hurt and I hit the character limit, so that's all I've got.

Posted: August 2
EDITED FOR EVOLUTION UPDATE:
My prior review still stands true for the game along with the following addition:

The good fishing gear is now locked behind the reputation system. You are required to do NON FISHING MISSIONS to get fishing gear. So running around for hours on end taking photos of flowers... makes no sense.

You are now paid per fish caught.

They added 8 new species to the starter map. Including Sturgeon. Sturgeon are strictly bottom feeding fish... but they still have no way to fish the bottom. So you have to fish for them on float in the top 1.4 meter of water. Makes tons of sense?

The Short review:
The maps are beautiful. It's a great treasure hunting game. But everything else needs a lot of work.

After 5 days of playing review:

Again, the maps are stunning in standard fashion for the Dev. But after 5 days the actual mechanics have been the biggest let down with The Angler.

I do appreciate the fact that you can throw a float, lure, or jig on a spinning rod. This is a realistic thing to do. Spinning rods are versatile like that. So that is a positive for the game.
The treasure hunt missions are a nice break from the fishing...

Now for the bad, the fishing:
The income thing is not explained and is based off of xp gained and not per fish (not explained anywhere.)
Line is chosen by the rod's max rated capability, I don't know what to say on that. Just strange.
For casting, you can cast short or long. There is no real in between. Can't "clip" to a specific distance.
Gear is exceptionally limited. There are no leaders, a 10lb pike would shred through the lines they have. Steel leaders would make sense here, don't exist in the game.
Catfish are bottom dwellers, but you catch them on the surface... again, don't know what to say on that.
Physics for Jig fishing: broken at best? Jigs drop fairly fast when not reeling, but when reeling at the slowest speed and obvious slack is in the line they stay at the same depth.
They give you bass boats, but no sonar/depth sounder or a trolling motor.
The SUV's... nauseating to drive. There is something about the camera in the SUV's that turn them into a vomit comet.
No bottom/feeder fishing. Don't know why, got the fish and bait in game that this would make sense for it, no form of bottom fishing implemented.
Can only fish 1 rod. Only fishing game I've seen that you cannot fish more than 1 rod at a time.
Visual bugs/short comings like hands clipping through the reels, or fishing from a boat and seeing your shadow and it just doesn't match what your character is doing. It's like playing a horror game at times with the shadow thing and the strange almost moaning sound on the starter map.
The multiplayer: you can shut it off, but it's not explained how to. No blacklist option for the rude lot that will park their boat on top of you or come and throw their line right on your's. I realize rude players are a thing, just give us tools to combat the problem "children."

It's a lot like seeing a really good kit car. It looks sharp, it looks like it's fast... but then you realize the body is sitting on a rusted out 1972 VW chassis and the engine has 1 dead cylinder, 2 fouled plugs and a bad rear main seal. Also 2nd gear is stripped out and the clutch is slipping like mad.

I just can't suggest this game to anyone when there are free options out there with way better mechanics. Even for half the price you get better mechanics on another. I bought this game on a deep discount so I don't feel too ripped off. I just feel that this doesn't live up to other games in the Dev's library for quality (Hunter CotW.) Maybe eventually they will fix it all, or maybe they'll just keep pumping out DLC for it and say it's fine as is. Don't know.

Posted: December 26, 2022
UPDATED REVIEW - OLD REVIEW IS BELOW

Patch 1.2.1 has been released. It's been over 30 days since we got a patch, and all they've focused on is increasing diamond rarity spawn rates. 30 days for spawn rates! Also, a developer has commented on my review, asking to join Discord. I've been on the discord for a few months now, and everyone is making lots of suggestions to improve the game, but the devs are responding very slowly, if at all, despite the large number of requests! The discord is also becoming less and less active, mainly because there is no proper communication between the developers and the players. Unfortunately, as evidenced by this patch, the devs have ignored what the players have requested, no one knows why because there is no communication, but this is also why players are leaving the game on a daily basis.We get a maximum of 200 players per day, and this continues to drop; it used to be 500+ players.

This game really has a future if they start listening to the players quickly and push the patches faster; otherwise, I fear the worst for this game.
So much potential! I hope the developers finally focus on what the community is asking for. In the future, I will update my review as needed as patches happen that steer the game in a better direction.

Meanwhile, I and the community mostly keep asking for:
- Set the time yourself because some people can't play in the dark and because some fish become more active at certain times.
- Make the game more about fishing and release updates accordingly; the game is now mainly focused on exploring the map and not fishing.
- We can't talk freely because of the chat system.
- Fish spawns and quests feel programmed without realism.
- There are still 30 inventory slots available! This is really little, and nobody understands why they can't increase it! There is a lot of annoyance here because you have to travel a long distance back to the store to change things.
- Carp fishing is missing.
- Trolls missing.
- Feeder fishing is missing.
- You can't move when your rod is in the water.
- You have no rod support, so you can't fish with multiple rods.
- Fish spawn and behavior feel extremely scripted and unnatural.
- Your score is based only on the line thickness you use; the reel and rod don't matter
- More camera options, such as third-person and underwater cameras, are required.
- When compared to the default map, the DLC map performs horribly.
- There are no weather effects.
- Achievements are all based on everything except fishing!! I've been trying to get 100% for a long time now.

=======================================================================

ORIGINAL REVIEW


COTW Angler has some of the most beautiful scenery I've seen in any fishing game. There is lots of beautiful terrain with rivers and lakes. But that's the only big plus the game has at the moment: it looks good.
The game itself is less; the developers have focused way too much on exploring the map instead of fishing, which is what the game should be all about. Your first main quest involves driving around the entire map, visiting outposts and unlocking new towns. And this on narrow roads where your car can become stuck quickly. To give you an idea, this is a community made map of all locations, objects, and POI:

If you have a quest to catch a diamond fish, for example, the game will continue to spawn fish until you have caught the required fish. If you don't have an active quest, all the fish disappear, and you regularly catch nothing.
This is also a stupid system; big fish can only be caught with specific hooks; otherwise, the diamond fish will not bite. In real life, you never know what you're going to catch, even if you use smaller hooks.

For 30 EUR, I absolutely cannot recommend this game. What I personally would like to change:

- Change the time so you don't get stuck in the middle of the night for hours.
- Focus less on map exploration and more on fishing.
- The chat, allow us to speak freely with no fixed messages.
- Make fish spawns more balanced throughout the game, not just when you have a quest.
- The ability to muffle the director and the woman at the desk.
- Expand your inventory space; you only have 30 slots for hooks, lures, fishing rods, and so on.

The game hardly ran at 60fps and now seems to run smooth as can be for me but I know that may not be the case for everyone. This I'm very happy to see.


-Performance

-Multiplayer adjustments/fixes

And that's where the good ends.

-Can't net fish

-Can't move while casted
-No action camera (This isn't quite a fishing sim so why not a close up camera for the hook/fish?)
- Nothing to do that are fishing related

-Bugs everywhere. Multiplayer bugs, fishing bugs, lure bugs, fish spawn out of thin air to bite your lure (sadly, I wouldn't be surprised if this was intentional)

DLC (currently free to own as of writing this) this game is worth at most 15$. This isn't a good fishing game quite yet. They'd need to remove the fetch items, dumb lore dumps and forced map exploration then add the other half of the fishing game for this game to really be worth the money.


Edit
10 hours in and I'm still not convinced. The game loop is BAD. The three most important things in a fishing game are just so far off from being ready that it's really sad that the game came out like this. The fishing animations (casting, reeling, inability to move, no netting), the water quality/physics and the fish animations/AI are all atrocious. The only things this game has going for it is the map. Until you start exploring and realize how empty and useless it is. Edited Original review. Toned it down a bit and made some more concise critiques:
2 Hour Review:
Picture this. You're an avid fisherman looking for a fresh experience. You've spent half of your pension and abandoned your wife to travel thousands of miles to fish at the Golden Ridge Reservation with none other than Wal-marts hardiest Wonder Woman hunting & fishing rod with included Batman themed bobber.

You're greeted by a woman on a walkie-talkie who does their best to man-splain how to cast your mint condition rod and reel. Fine. You cast Batman a few times to appease this radio-wench. But casting is not enough. She forces you to Assassin's Creed climb the nearest fire watch station. She explains that although fishing supplies are abundant, maps are only given to the elite 0.1% of gamers. You must explore the map by foot or by Jurassic Park jeep to discover anything meaningful.

But at last. You've made it to the first small outpost in the center of the reservation. You can finally start what you came here to do. Your batman bobber weeps tears of joy. You cast Wonder Woman as far as you can into the Lake. You wait. And wait. And wait. Nothing bites. You move spots and cast again. You wait longer than before.

2 hours have gone by and you've spent the majority of your vacation in a jeep listening to the local game warden complain about all of the ecologically devastating corporations that operate freely throughout the worlds emptiest reservation. You pick up notes, trinkets and report sparkling plant life along the way, only attempting to fish only once or twice along the way.

It's finally hit you that your newly broken marriage and 30 years worth of your pension may not have been worth doing fetch quests for the worlds worst park ranger and extortionist bait shop owner.

You load a 12 gauge shell into your Wal-mart Wonder Woman hunting & fishing rod and pray there are more than 12 species of fish in Heaven.


Serious Review:
This is by far the worst fishing game ever made. PS2 fishing games function better than this. This is 80% exploration, 10% reloading the game, 5% Googling questions, 4% searching for the Steam refund policy and 1% actually fishing. I am greatly disappointed to see so many people give the pass to this game. It may have the POTENTIAL to be good but by golly is it so far away from it. There's practically nothing good going for it in it's current state.

The BAD:
And the actual fishing part of the game could not be any more shallow.
No moving after casting
Only 2 reeling speed animations. You could be at 1x speed but your hand looks like it's reeling in 500yrds a minute.
Mulitplayer just doesn't work the majority of the time
The water quality is HORRENDOUS
Fishing rod animations are broken/unrealistic
Fish animations and AI are very unrealistic. Some fish must be broken because I have google how to catch a few diffrenet kinds and have gotten 0 after IRL hours of trying. I check what location, bait/lures to use and time of day and get the same 4-5 fish every time.
No real sense of progression besides a Lvl number and currency. You can have maxed out gear in less than 3 hours without trying that hard.
Can't pass time for some ungodly reason. I've also noticed that the time of day doesn't cycle correctly the majority of my play time.
No special equipment (tents, tripods etc)
Animations instead of netting fish
Only 12 species of fish on a map more than large enough to house more fish.
The map UI simply doesn't work. It is extremely non-user friendly. Mini map is needed badly.
The majority of the 'quests' expect you to explore rather than fish. Some quest are outright broken/buggy to complete.
These are just things I've noticed in the first 10 HOURS of playing.

The unfortunate truth however is that this will likely go the route of HCOTW and all meaningful content will be behind a pay wall. Only pick this up at $5 or less. I will not shill for another dev/game but there are PLENTY of better and fully functioning fishing sims out there. This one adds nothing new while being incredibly regressive in the fishing sim genre.

Posted: October 5, 2022
This game needs an AWFUL amount of work to be a good fishing game, but the potential is HUGE. If they can patch it in time it could very well be one of the best fishing games to ever exist. But there are some glaring problems and the game feels very early access even though it isn't somehow..

I've just realised I never put down the positives of this game, so lemme do that before I list the issues.

Here are some of the good aspects of the game.

-Graphics are very pretty.
-Sound effects are quite nice.
-Catching fish is fairly satisfying.
-Driving around on a car/boat is relaxing.
-Doing the challenges are pretty fun and gives a direction for the player to head towards while teaching the player about spots where they could fish.
-You can see the fish swimming around under the water and you can actually catch them.
-Collectibles are quite fun to obtain.
-There are a lot of nice fishing spots that feel calm and interesting to fish at.
-You're able to change your character design completely whenever you want.
-NPCs that talk make the game feel more lively, and while there isn't many of them the ones that talk do make the world feel more alive. (Even if sometimes a particular shopkeeper talks too much)
-Souvenirs a good step in the right direction, but souvenirs also don't work as a good progression style because you're not actually improving but looking more special, but since it's there as an end-game thing when you'd already have all the good equipment, I'll leave it as a positive thing)

Here are some of the issues I've noticed that need to be added/removed/adjusted/fixed..
(as these get fixed, I'll put down next to the issue whether it's been fixed/improved/revised etc. from what I've seen)

-Mirrors on vehicles don't work, immersion breaking.
-(Improved) There's a slight delay between hooking and starting to pull in the fish, doesn't feel smooth.
-Tension on bottom right needs to split between rod, reel and line (similar to setting tension settings to pro in fishing planet, you can see which of your parts are weak and holding you back)
-Tension meter needs to be smoother, the UI is very jumpy looking.
-Drag percentage needs to be closer to the tension meter so you don't have to look across your screen to see drag.
-(Improved) Water textures need work, shimmering/blurry textures break immersion and immersion is extremely important in a simulator
-Bait count UI, why do I need to open my inventory to see how many baits I have left.. Also, show rod name, which rod setup it is etc.
-Repairing equipment for money. Maintenance costs makes a simulation a simulation.
-Better camera movement options, ability to reduce sway when rod is casted and moving camera for better motion. Make it so the rod moves static with the camera. What is this weird slow camera following? I've noticed there's an issue as well if you pull up the rod with the right mouse button and let go while moving the rod in a direction, it'll do some weird catch-up. Why not just keep camera straight, and adjust it evenly with the rod movement.. (Fishing Planet ffs, there's a reason they're still going strong)
-Time forwarding to change time of day.
-Ability to zoom towards bobber/bail when float fishing
-Ability to see how deep lure is when lure fishing
-Stop vehicles from de-spawning if you close the game. Nothing like being stranded in the middle of nowhere, sure you can fast travel but if you've driven quite far you're stuck walking around unless you want to go all the way back.
-Make UI animations smoother, holding E on objects and watching the bar fill up at 3 fps looks very janky.
-Performance is... eh for the graphics. Everything maxed out, it doesn't look super amazing but frames aren't great. (average 90 on RTX 3080 @ 1080p)
-Make Cars/Boats cost money to add more progression elements. I want to earn the right to drive a boat/car, but I guess for a game like this it might be a necessity so this one could probably be skipped all together.
-Make Sophia Taylor talk less, I can't think and it's super distracting when she has to open her mouth every 5 seconds while I'm trying to figure out my setup, buying or selling etc.
-Make shop UI a lot better. It's terribly janky and half the time I accidentally close the menu, then I have to step back and step forward again for the option to appear to open the shop UI again.
-Make it so you lose hook/bait/line if you break the line, this incentivizes people not to screw up or to lose their lines to which you could also integrate leaders into the game.
-Allow free movement when standing on the boat. Being locked to four separate positions is not fun and feels very limiting in a game about being in the open.
-Make fish easier to see. I can't tell if it's the bad textures, or lighting but it's almost impossible to see where the fish is going or where the line is most of the time.
-Allow custom map markers with tags that we can rename. Right now, if you find a spot you like, you need to write it down elsewhere which once again, breaks immersion.
-Minimap, floating map or radar would be very convenient and quality of life. Would also help to not make me open my map every 15 seconds.
-Boats need to be faster, they're way too slow for the amount of water travelling you can do.
-Third person option would be nice but not necessary.
-Exploring the wilderness is fun, but it feels lifeless. At least add some passive small/large animals that might run around in the distance, more effects like rain/thunderstorm.
-(Slightly Improved, Game tells you when people catch fish and when you join a multiplayer session) Urgently needs some form of text chat/voice chat and friends list so players can communicate and fish together. Also adds life to the world which supports one of my other points.
-Add more role-playing elements, progression elements all that stuff. Make it feel like I'm progressing and becoming a better fisherman, I wanna see more bars go up, I want the xp gain to be more satisfying, all that good stuff. I want my dopamine receptors to fly off the second I catch a fish.
-More tackle/equipment options.

Problems aside, it's pretty fun. There aren't a lot of decent options when it comes to fishing simulators and as long as they do good and keep the development going it could be absolutely awesome.

When that time comes, I'll give it a positive review.

At this point in time, the $42.95 AUD price tag is absolutely not worth the money for the game you get. I'd say maybe, $20-$25 is a lot better. When a lot of the features get added and the game gets patched then I could see the price tag more reasonably.

There are a lot of nice collectibles and points of interest which give you rewards (cash/xp) for doing so which is pretty nice. (same as theHunter: Call of the Wild)

It would most likely be a successful game if a lot of the issues were fixed. We are pretty much starving for a decent fishing simulator and honestly, the best one, Fishing Planet gets boring after a little while.

There are a decent amount of rods, reels, baits, lines etc. but there definitely needs to be more.

I think they need to take a lot of good ideas from Fishing Planet and implement them all here. (Minus the P2W micro-transactions of course, this is a $42.95 AUD game but lets be honest we'll probably get at least some form of micro-transaction sooner than expected..)

Once the problems are fixed and the game is a lot more acceptable I'll change it to a positive review. For now, I unfortunately gotta recommend against it.

If you got money to burn and you reeeeeaallyy wanna play a decent potentially great upcoming fishing simulator, then this is definitely worth it.

Just, for the love of everything, don't add DLCs till you at least make it an acceptable fishing game..

TL;DR - Absolutely massive potential, has lots of issues that need to be patched/fixed, UI needs to be updated and features/QoL need to be implemented. Performance isn't great either even on a powerful GPU. $42.95 AUD P

Posted: September 3, 2022
12hrs in, and I really can't recommend this game in its current state, it's not about the water, it's not about minor bugs, it's not about it being an arcade game, it's about the game being released with fundamental flaws in it's prime objective of being about fishing.

Fine, it's not a sim, it's miles from fishing planet and light years from rf4 but there are some real basics that are missing that simply should'n't have allowed the game to be a full release. Even the most basic arcade fishing games allow you to cast the distance you chose, not a preset of long or short. Being locked in your position when you hook a big fish or wish to slightly reposition whilst the bait is out, it's a basic of fishing games.

The day/night cycle is ridiculous, I have no problem with having rolling time but shorten the 24hr cycle to something that doesn't leave players stumbling around in the dark for ages, literally as there's no real flashlight in the game despite the supposed patch. Surely some dev spotted this as a serious issue?

OK so the multiplayer issue is more of a bug that will be resolved but as the social aspect was the main thrust of the game, you'd think they may have just got this sorted before full release.

Yes there are good points in the game, plenty in fact but the bottom line is that it was released well before it should've been, and a company shouldn't be rewarded by a thumbs up for selling a half finished product.

I waited to buy this game because it was obviously released before it was ready. Several improvements have been made for sure, but I still would not recommend anyone purchase it. My biggest gripes are the graphics and performance, as I feel EW's other COTW game (theHunter) is much cleaner looking with way more frames. The water up close is really great along with the underwater detail, but at distance the quality begins to suffer.

The fishing mechanics have improved what I've read and seen, but it could certainly be better. The tutorial had me catching largemouth bass with bread baits, which just isn't something that makes sense to someone who has fished for them my entire life and know them to be a predatory fish by nature. Finally, I've been progressing through the warden/tour mission a bit and his incessant whining at every checkpoint has really soured me on the game. I get that America has a tarnished past, but most countries do as well to some extent. The repeated negativity is both hypocritical and tiresome, and oddly found its way into a fishing game. To this day, the MS map in TH:COTW is the only map I've not purchased, and it's simply because the studio chose to ignorantly trash southerners instead of coming up with a solid, non-biased story as with every other reserve. In theAngler, it looks like the devs could only focus on relentless negativity instead of even a passable plot.

Posted: September 5, 2022
Having played a number of fishing games, I had high hopes for this as I enjoy Call of the Wild: The Hunter.

The open-world approach is brilliant, similarly to The Hunter. However, there doesn't seem to be the same level of fishing detail here as there is hunting in The Hunter, which is quite strange as the is targeted as a fishing game.

I've only played for a short while, so please correct me if some of these are in the game but I've not encountered them.

1) Float fishing: no way of plumbing the depths to determine the actual depth you are fishing at. This is a basic skill to ensure you have your bait at the optimum level just above the riverbed.
2) Can't seem to adjust the length you cast, it always seems to go out to one distance depending on line/bait. So you end up having to cast the reel in to get in closer, other than using the underarm cast which has a very limited distance.
3) No way to clip the line to ensure you cast the same distance.
4) No bank sticks to other rod rests to put your rod on so you can fish with more than one rod at a time.
5) No way to feeder fish
6) No ground bait or catapult to feed a particular area
7) With advances in fishing games, why don't we see the option to use shot on the line with our floats to change the way the bait settles
8) The water physics doesn't seem right. Although floats do move a little, there isn't accurate in flowing water, and they seem very static in that they don't appear to bob up and down.
9) There is water in the boats when standing up and fishing, almost expecting the boat to sink any time.
10) Why is there only one type of boat? Why not have canoes and kayaks.
11) There is no way of telling the time, some watch or SatNav like in The Hunter would be better than the map.
12) The Hunter had a camera function, which would be a nice addition to just pressing F12, so you'd have Zoom and variable focus.
13) Being able to set up a Bivvy, tent or proper fishing shelter would be ideal along with the option for a chair to sit on and watch while you fish. All standard fishing equipment. Plus it could be used to fast forward time if you wished to sleep through the night.
14) An option to find some live bait would be a nice addition, such as digging up worms.
15) Some wildlife around wouldn't go a miss. In particular, birds floating and landing/taking off on the water. IRL swans and ducks do swim up to you, so it would be nice for that to be reflected in the wildlife around the world.

The game is a beautiful world to fish in, it just seems that fishing isn't the aim of the game, it seems more about exploring which is nice, but surely not the aim of the game.

I don't know what if any road-map timeline there is for the future. I certainly hope to see some if not all of the above included, otherwise, this is a major opportunity missed to create the best fishing game on the market.

All that said, I'd recommend the game, but it just feels incomplete and should be in beta stage rather than a final release.

Posted: August 18
While I've owned this game for some time now, I only just started playing after the major content update a day or two ago. I can't speak for how the game was prior to now, but as someone experiencing it as it is intended as of the new update. The tutorial missions are very well explained, and there's even an accessibility option for normal casting (Which is typically done by pulling the mouse back and then pushing it forward) As I have neither the space on my desk for such motions as well as shoulder issues, the right click and cast load time alternative works wonders for me!

The game itself is relaxing, enjoyable not just as an outlet to play simulated fishing, but also a beautiful hiking game. There are gorgeous places to see and find, even when you're not on the water! The music is soft and uplifting when present, but also fades out to just sounds of nature depending on where you've stopped to rest, much like it does in COTW:The Hunter. And similarly to that game, I wish we could ride horses! Maybe a future DLC? The environment would lend well to such a feature.

As far as the fishing itself goes, there are many decent options for quickly setting up a new rod and tackle, very easy to understand. Unlike some fishing games I could mention, this one is extremely fair- a snapped line does not result in the player having to figure out how much line to add to the rod or apply a new hook or lose a lure you only have one of- Instead, a snapped line simply loses the fish you were after, and I assume any baits outside of lures is probably lost. I was at first a little unsure of the actual mechanic for fishing and where the game expected you to put your hands on the keyboard but once I understood, it's been smooth sailing! I am pleasantly surprised and having a great time. It may not be quite as fun as COTW:TH, but it is still fun! Personally I wish fishing had just been added TO the hunting game since hunting and fishing go hand in hand, but I can also see why they chose to make it separate. Overall great game!

Posted: September 1, 2022
I can't in good conscience recommend this game in its current state. The marketing for this game is downright dishonest, and whether you enjoy the game or not, you can't disagree with the objective truth that this game doesn't deliver on its promises and should've been released as early access with a discount. It seems incredibly rushed, the fish don't behave as advertised, character creation is awful, and the visuals are just...odd.

From the product description:

Battle a variety of unique species in an authentic and engaging fishing experience. Each fish type has its own set of behaviors and traits, which influence what tackle they’re attracted to, how they fight when hooked, and what actions they can perform to escape. Combined with a system that realistically spawns fish based on water depth, temperature, altitude, and more, every catch becomes a lasting memory.
Master distinct fishing techniques and adapt your strategy to land the most impressive catch. Purchase gear and build custom fishing rigs using a wide selection of rods, reels, lures, hooks, floats, and jigheads. Create your angler and customize their look and attributes. Complete challenges to earn unique rewards and discover the world through meaningful story missions.

I've noticed that time of day, water temperature, depth, bait and lure types, retrieval etc. simply don't matter and fish will either bite every cast or not at all for what feels like hours. The game lists bait and lure preferences for each fish and not only are many of them inaccurate to real life, they seem inaccurate to the game. I've thrown bait that is recommended for fish in front of those fish and they ignore it, then I'll throw some random bait on the hook and catch them every cast. The character creator was just haphazardly tacked on, there are very few options (one hairstyle and hair color for each gender) and the models themselves are mediocre at best.

I tend to enjoy Expansive World's games, but I can't support dishonest and predatory marketing. This is the No Man's Sky of the fishing genre. Either they *can't* deliver on their promises, OR it'll take months or even years for this to be a complete product and it should've been made clear that this is an early access product that isn't worth $30 USD. If they greatly improve the game in the coming months and years and finally make this the genre-defining fishing experience that they claimed it would be, I'll happily change my review. I cannot recommend this game at this time.

PLEASE do not pay attention to the negative reviews for this game, i looked thru all the reviews before deciding to try this game for myself. I love fishing in real life, ive lived and fished in Kentucky my whole life, and ive played dozens of fishing sim games throughout my life. This is the best by far fishing game i have ever played. First day i bought this game i put in 15 hours. anyone that has played this game for less than 5 hours need not even review it. Soooo lets talk about it.
The Good.....
1.Open world, and i do mean open world, you can go anywhere and fish any body of water
2.Multiplayer, its fantastic, never ran into a single game breaking bug at all in 15 hours of nonstop play with
2 other friends.
3.Variety-So man poles, reels, baits, and items to get and work for, there is a money system which you obtain
thru catching fish and completing challenges and none of it is bought with real money.
4.The boats drive very well, though the jeeps are rough im sure it'll be worked on thru time
5.The fishing is so much fun and not ARCADE like at all as some comments have stated. Its hard to find fish and their not jumping in the boat which i enjoy, if you fish in real life at all you'll respect this games fishing mechanics.

NOW for the "not bad" but hope gets added

1. i wanna be able to walk around on the boat rather than stand in one spot.

ecosystem
